page.title: 03Farming
page.content: Harthill Farms, a partnership of Lord and Lady Forbes, the Master of Forbes and the Hon. Jonathan Forbes, extends to 1,900 acres of farmland which rises from the Don valley to the Grampian foothills and produces milk, beef and cereals. 300 Friesian cows are milked in two dairies and all calves are reared as replacements for the dairy herds, the suckler herd or for beef. A 120 cow autumn calving suckler herd is run on Castle Forbes policies and hill land. 850 acres of cereals are grown comprising the more recently introduced winter barley and wheat together with the more traditional spring barley. Oil seed rape was grown for the first time this year.
